intro: Cyrtandra anaxie, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
